result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Janz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO THIS CASE:  submit DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving entire sentence in count two and one half (1/2) Initial Confinement in count one.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Conditions of Extended suepvison to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised he may never again possess firearms or weapons; and his civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  To be served in prison.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Janz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (25 pages) commencing APRIL 30, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Michael L Janz in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Michael L Janz in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 48 months years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 30 months with credit for 112 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
    
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does NOT qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving ENTIRE SENTENCE IN COUNT 2 AND 1/2 initial confinement in COUNT 1 .
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.


COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 0 days served; TO BE SERVED IN PRISON.   Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES IN COUNT 1.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant Michael L Janz in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael L Janz in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the defense:  Motion in Limine.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Michael L Janz not in court, in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Case set for final pretrial on 3-25-14, 8:30 and  Jury trial scheduled for 04-02-2014 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-25-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Michael L Janz not in court, in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files certified documents with the court from Waushara County, Wisconsin.
Parties request adjournment for further scheduling conference.  Court approves adjournment.  Case adjourned for further scheduling conference in Branch 26.
Clerk:  jms

Certification of transcript of proceedings of  PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  JANUARY 21, 2014  received and filed. (10  Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Stephen Sargent - SPD.

Defendant Michael L Janz in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael L Janz in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Frederick Gayle-MCSD Deputy.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charges.

Defendant Michael L Janz in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael L Janz in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
